intro: Microthlaspi perfoliatum, commonly known as the devil's-bit scabious, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant is often found in dry, sunny grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has a long flowering period, typically from late spring to early autumn. Microthlaspi perfoliatum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
